revised_title: An Account of the Oxford Earthquake of 1683
tldr: A fellow of a college in Oxford and a member of the Royal Society provides an account of the earthquake that occurred in Oxford and its surrounding areas on September 17, 1683. The author discusses the time of the earthquake, the weather leading up to it, and the various observations made by others, including the appearance of ignes fatui and the trembling motion of the earthquake. The author also notes the lack of significant damage caused by the earthquake.
